node.title: Kshama Stewart Seattle Recall Election Results as Votes Counted
node.alt: Seattle City Councilmember Kshama Sawant speaks to reporters before her inauguration and "Tax Amazon 2020 Kickoff" event in Seattle, Washington on January 13, 2020.
node.description: Preliminary results show voters are narrowly in favor of recalling the socialist Seattle City Councilmember.
node.content:
["Preliminary results show voters are narrowly in favor of recalling socialist Seattle City Councilmember Kshama Sawant.", "About 53 percent voted to recall Sawant, the council's longest-tenured member, in the first count released by officials on Tuesday night, The Seattle Times reported.", "The election is being conducted by mail-in vote, and additional votes will be counted in the coming days. The initial count represented about 41 percent of District 3's 77,579 registered voters, according to the Times.", "The recall question on the ballot cited a minor campaign finance violation that Sawant acknowledged and has paid a fine for.", "", "
Seattle City Councilmember Kshama Sawant speaks to reporters before her inauguration and \"Tax Amazon 2020 Kickoff\" event in Seattle, Washington on January 13, 2020.
", "It also cites her decision to let a crowd of racial justice protesters into City Hall while it was closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic in June last year. She dos not deny opening City Hall, but says her action did not violate any laws.", "A third charge accuses her of leading a protest march to the home of Mayor Jenny Durkan, even though Durkan's address was protected by a state confidentiality law due to her prior work as a federal prosecutor.", "Sawant admits taking part in the march, but denies having led it to Durkan's house.", "If Sawant is recalled, she would be removed from office on December 17. The other eight members of the council would appoint a replacement until a special election is held in November 2022.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated."]
